newsitem.title: UK: Lower US cotton prices fail to move other sellers.
newsitem.headline: Lower US cotton prices fail to move other sellers.

text.p: Friday's sharp fall in the New York contract exerted only a limited influence on trade price ideas for non-US cottons for shipment over the next three months.

Those sellers with uncommited supplies, in particular of the popular West African and Central Asian styles, remained reluctant to discount offering rates in the face of tightening supply ahead of the movement of the main Northern hemisphere crops.
But on most European raw cotton markets mill demand was sporadic, to fill gaps, and only a little new business was done.
